title: Arsenal Diary : What in store this week | News
body_text:
After back-to-back away games at Preston North End and Newcastle United, Mikel Arteta’s squad are off to Inter Milan and Chelsea this week.
Our women’s team are also set for an Emirates Stadium return, while two of our academy sides are in action as well.
Please note, all times are in BST
TUESDAY
6pm - Mikel Arteta press conference
Mikel Arteta will be back in front of the media at the San Siro to look ahead to Wednesday’s Champions League tie against Inter Milan.
Supporters can watch the press conference on Arsenal.com or the official app, and we will publish a round-up of quotes shortly after.
WEDNESDAY
1.30pm - Inter Milan v Arsenal U19s
Our under-19s take on Inter’s youngsters in the UEFA Youth League at the Konami Youth Development Centre on Wednesday afternoon.
Max Porter’s young Gunners are looking for their second win of the competition, having so far lost to Atalanta and Shakhtar Donetsk and beaten Paris Saint-Germain.
8pm - Inter Milan v Arsenal
A meeting between two unbeaten sides in the Champions League this season, like Inter Milan we have won two and drawn one of our three matches so far.
Wednesday’s game will be shown live on TNT Sports for supporters in the UK, while we will also be providing audio commentary coverage on Arsenal.com and the official app.
THURSDAY
Renee Slegers press conference
Interim head coach Renee Slegers will return to Sobha Realty Training Centre for her pre-Brighton press conference on Thursday.
She’ll look ahead to Friday’s Barclays Women’s Super League game at Emirates Stadium and share the latest team news.
FRIDAY
Mikel Arteta press conference
Mikel Arteta previews another London derby this week, facing the media for his pre-Chelsea press conference on Friday.
You can watch it on Arsenal.com or the official app and read up on everything discussed afterwards.
7pm - Arsenal Women v Brighton & Hove Albion
WSL football returns to Emirates Stadium with the visit of Brighton & Hove Albion Women on Friday night.
Tickets remain available, and the game will be shown live on the WSL YouTube channel for supporters who are unable to attend.
SATURDAY
12pm - Reading v Arsenal U18s
Adam Birchall’s under-18s travel to Bearwood Park Training Facility to take on Reading in the U18 Premier League South this weekend.
We will publish a full match report here shortly after full-time, but you can also follow updates from the game on our academy X account.
SUNDAY
4.30pm - Chelsea v Arsenal
Stamford Bridge is the venue for Sunday’s showdown against Chelsea as us and the Blues both look to close the gap at the top of the Premier League table.
We will bring you all the pre-match build-up on Arsenal.com and the official app with our match day show Live From N5, and supporters in the UK can watch the game live on Sky Sports.
